usefulItems: large bowl, cling film, baking tray, cooling rack, oven
title: Focaccia

ingredients.content: 30 g olive oil, plus more for greasing and drizzling
350 g water, warm, plus extra for sprinkling

preparations.content: Lightly oil a large bowl and large piece of cling film then set aside
Place flour, sugar, yeast, oil, water and fine sea salt in mixing bowl then mix <b>20 sec/speed 6<b>. Knead <b>2 min/<b>.

Transfer sticky dough to oiled bowl. Return mixing bowl to base and spin remaining dough off blades <b>5 sec/speed 6<b>. Scrape out excess dough and add to bowl. Cover with prepared cling film and leave to prove until doubled in size (approx. 1-2 hours). Towards the end of rising time oil a large baking tray then set aside.
Spread dough out on prepared baking tray with aid of oiled spatula then leave to prove a further 30 minutes.

Using oiled fingertips, make indentations all over the risen dough and press tomato halves, cut sides up, onto the dough. Sprinkle evenly with rosemary needles, coarse salt and the extra water, then drizzle with olive oil. Bake 20 minutes (220°C) or until golden brown.
Allow to cool on baking tray for 5 minutes then transfer to a cooling rack. Eat warm or allow to cool completely.

hintsAndTricks: Dip your fingertips in a little oil before making the indentations in the dough in step 6.
Fry some red onion in a little olive oil and spread on top before baking. Use or omit cherry tomatoes as desired.
Add 40 g sundried tomatoes with the flour in step 2.
Sprinkle with 3 Tbsp parmesan and some freshly ground black pepper before baking, omitting the extra salt.
